content.1: Moreover Job continued his parable, and said,
content.4: My lips shall not speak wickedness, nor my tongue utter deceit.
content.5: God forbid that I should justify you: till I die I will not remove mine integrity from me.
content.6: My righteousness I hold fast, and will not let it go: my heart shall not reproach
content.7: Let mine enemy be as the wicked, and he that riseth up against me as the unrighteous.
content.9: Will God hear his cry when trouble cometh upon him?
content.10: Will he delight himself in the Almighty? will he always call upon God?
content.11: I will teach you by the hand of God:
content.12: Behold, all ye yourselves have seen
content.15: Those that remain of him shall be buried in death: and his widows shall not weep.
content.16: Though he heap up silver as the dust, and prepare raiment as the clay;
content.18: He buildeth his house as a moth, and as a booth
content.19: The rich man shall lie down, but he shall not be gathered: he openeth his eyes, and he
content.20: Terrors take hold on him as waters, a tempest stealeth him away in the night.
content.21: The east wind carrieth him away, and he departeth: and as a storm hurleth him out of his place.
